comment: Very structured class with a very clear schedule given to us at the start of every week. There is a lot of rather tedious homework, so beware of that at least. Weekly reading and long assessment based on the reading (open book/note), lecture videos, labs, and occasional discussions and tests. Try your best to stay on top of things n youll be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: SUPER EASY! Prof has an easy schedule of Textbook questions and then a discussion post now and then. The lab is only a quiz every week. You can pass this class so easy. The prof also sends out an email every Sunday of what you need to do that week :)
There's a lot of work, but this is a pretty easy class. Would recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This professor was great at communicating which is important for online classes, she seems to care a lot about her students. At the end of the semester, she also gives you three extra credit assignments which I recommend taking, one of them being 5 points towards your lowest exam.

Very easy class, syllabus is kind of scary at the beginning, but if you stick with the class it becomes so easy. The work seemed so confusing and scattered at first. however it is all easy no lockdown and you will get the hang of it. Never talked to or seen the professor, but she does answer emails in a reasonable time.

super easy class! course schedule is super clear and the work is pretty easy. just one assignment each week thats super easy and occasionally labs and quizzes that are easy. super organized and easy just keep up with the assignments and youll do good
The class was very easy. She was helpful and responded quickly to emails. Easy A, and definitely a class I would again!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework
Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Professor Spikes was quick to respond to emails, and was super understanding throughout the semester. When it came to the course work, I found that the tests were a bit difficult to understand and you have to take your time on them. HW is not too difficult, but there's a lot of reading, so make sure you have a lot of time set aside for this class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: I was online so I did not have much interaction with Professor Spikes, but from what I saw from the lecture videos, she is very nice and enthusiastic about her class. There are three tests during the semester and none of them is a cakewalk. Study and do your weekly work and you will do fine.

Such an easy class, tests are kinda difficult and that's why I made a B. She grades easily on papers, but the articles are kinda hard at first. I had to read them over and over to fully understand. It's a really easy class, but the Connect has 50 concepts so that takes a while, but you have the whole week to do it. She's really sweet too.

I try my best to give my professors the benefit of the doubt. However, not with this one. 1. A lot of the instructions for things are expectations rather than actual teaching. 2. No matter how much I study or read the notes the test was always super hard. 3. The writing assignment is difficult if you don't know APA format.

There's a book assignment and a lecture every week. She also uploads the PowerPoint she gets her lectures from. They are very long PowerPoints, but pretty thorough. There are three homework assignments where you read articles and answer questions. The material is hard, but if you study, you can pass.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I took the class online and each week we had one formative due with tests every few weeks. Those were both open note and fairly easy. The only other assignment were the homework writings which i know tripped a lot of people up. I would recommend the class though. as long as you do the hw youll be fine. its really not much.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class was heavy on the information but luckily the tests are open book/note if you have enough time. The tests are hard even with notes. There is way too much content and its nots broken down she just reads her slides in her lectures so you are not missing anything if you dont watch them. Also group project is hard 10p essay and Presentation
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Would not take another class with her ever again. She is very knowledgeable but is very lecture heavy with TOO much information. She barely has any assignments to boost your grade up and VERY hard grader. She is very strict, and I asked for help on tests and she did not help whatsoever. Has no sympathy or mercy. Sorry but please don't take her.
